title: SpliceHack/Unique demons
data:
**Unique demons** in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") are more numerous than their incarnations in vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They also have lower AC, and are much more dangerous.

## Bribery

[Bribing](/wiki/Bribing "Bribing") a lawful [demon prince](/wiki/Demon_prince "Demon prince") is similar to *NetHack*, but with a few key differences. The demon will cycle through the following checks in order.

1. If the player has a [playing card deck](/wiki/Playing_card_deck "Playing card deck") in their inventory, the demon will offer to play a game of chance with the player for dominion of their soul. If the player refuses, the demon will get angry.
2. If the player has a powerful object in their inventory, the demon lord may demand it in exchange for safe passage. Objects demanded include any [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") (except [Sting](/wiki/Sting "Sting"), [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist"), and those necessary for [ascension](/wiki/Ascension "Ascension")), a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding"), or a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing").
3. If the player does not have a powerful object or refuses to hand it over, the demon will demand a monetary bribe of 2000–3000 [zorkmids](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid"), with an additional 1000 demanded if the player is of a different [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") to the demon. If the demon is in possession of the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") or the hero is deaf, a sum of money greater than the amount in the player's inventory is demanded.

## Dark speech

All hostile unique demons are capable of using **dark speech**. Each turn, there is a 1⁄18 chance that the demon utters something in the dark speech. If the player does not have sonic resistance and is not [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf"), one of several effects will occur.

| Probability | Effect                                                                                        |
| ----------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1⁄5         | Intrinsic loss, as if successfully attacked at night by a [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin"). |
| 1⁄5         | [Withering](/wiki/Withering "Withering") for 40–80 turns.                                     |
| 1⁄5         | Take 6d6 damage unless psychic resistant.                                                     |
| 2⁄5         | Nothing happens.                                                                              |

  3. If the player does not have a powerful object or refuses to hand it over, the demon will demand a monetary bribe of 2000–3000 zorkmids, with an additional 1000 demanded if the player is of a different alignment to the demon. If the demon is in possession of the Amulet of Yendor or the hero is deaf, a sum of money greater than the amount in the player's inventory is demanded.

Probability Effect
1⁄5 Intrinsic loss, as if successfully attacked at night by a gremlin.

List of unique demons

Name Sym Alignment AC Attacks Lair Notes
Juiblex & Chaotic −17 Engulfing 4d10 disease, Spit 3d6 acid Yes
Zuggotomoy & Chaotic −14 Claw 2d6 poisonous (dexterity), Claw 2d6 poisonous (dexterity), Tentacles 2d6, Passive 3d4 random element No Can create aspects of herself when coming into contact with corpses.

Geryon & Lawful −13 Claw 3d6, Claw 3d6, Sting 2d4 poison No
Dispater & Lawful −12 Weapon 4d6, Spell-casting 6d6 No Has a random spellbook, as opposed to a wand of striking in vanilla.
Malcanthet & Lawful −16 Gaze 4d6 blind, Weapon 2d6, Claw 2d6, Claw seduction Yes Can seduce the player regardless of their gender and orientation.
Baalzebub & Lawful −15 Bite 2d6 poison, Gaze 2d6 stun Yes
